message.content:
cs.GT, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IT, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with a problem of distributed learning in a network of agents, which involves communication and information exchange. This suggests that the paper may belong to the Game Theory (cs.GT) or Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper proposes an efficient method for learning that involves switching between Bayesian and non-Bayesian regimes, which may fall under the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. The paper also deals with information theory and communication costs, which may suggest the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves simulations to verify the theoretical findings, which may suggest the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category.
